Violation_Type: Failure to meet refugee eligibility criteria
Legal_Issue: Whether the RPD conducted an appropriate risk analysis and state protection analysis under section 97 of the IRPA
Application_Facts: Mr. Gudiel fled El Salvador due to threats from MS 13 gang members and sought refugee status in Canada
Decision_Outcome: RPD's decision was reasonable; application for judicial review dismissed
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of RPD's rejection of refugee claim
Defendant_Behavior: Threats by MS 13 gang members in El Salvador
Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution by non-state actors (MS 13)
Assessment_Factor: Credibility of testimony, availability of state protection
Procedural_Issue: Standard of review applied by Federal Court
Credibility_Assessment: Discrepancies found in Mr. Gudiel's testimony
Evidence_Used: Testimony of Mr. Gudiel, evidence of government efforts against gangs in El Salvador
Application_Basis: Personal risk upon return to home country
Relief_Sought: Overturning of RPD's decision and recognition as a protected person
Governing_Rule: Under section 97 of the IRPA, a claimant must demonstrate personal risk; state protection is presumed unless rebutted
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to provide consistent testimony and sufficient evidence to rebut state protection
Harm_Assessment: Risk of harm from MS 13 gang if returned to El Salvador
Cause_Description: Threats from MS 13 due to refusal to join the gang
Evidence_Handling: RPD assessed credibility and consistency of testimony
Legal_Provision_Violated: None found; claimant failed to meet burden under section 97
Misrepresentation_Element: Potential inaccuracies or omissions in testimony
Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal Court jurisdiction to review RPD decisions
Evidence_Assessment: Testimony deemed inconsistent; insufficient evidence to prove lack of state protection
Decision_Rationale: RPD found adequate state protection in El Salvador and credibility issues with claimant
Evidentiary_Issues: Credibility gaps and lack of corroborating evidence
